lines.content: * Represents the main application class for Charlotte.
* Constructs a Charlotte chatbot instance with the specified file path for data storage.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Starts and runs the Charlotte chatbot.
* This method displays the welcome message, then enters a loop where it continuously reads user commands,
* parses them, and executes the corresponding commands. The loop continues until an exit command is received.
* If any exceptions are encountered during command execution, an error message is displayed to the user.
* The main method to start the Charlotte chatbot.
* This method creates an instance of the Charlotte chatbot with the specified data file path and
* starts the application by calling the run method.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* Represents a command to add a task to the task list.
* Constructs an AddCommand instance with the specified task.
* @param task The task to be added to the task list.
* Returns the task associated with this AddCommand.
* Executes the command to add the task to the task list, updates the user interface, and saves the updated task list.
* This method adds the task to the TaskList, informs the user of the successful addition,
* and then saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks The TaskList object where the task will be added.
* @param ui The Ui object used to communicate with the user.
* @param storage The Storage object used to save the updated task list.
* @throws CharlotteException If an error occurs while saving the task list to storage.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CharlotteException {
ui.showMessage("Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + task
+ "\n Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* The Command class serves as an abstract class for all commands that can be executed
* Constructs a Command instance. By default, a command is not an exit command.
* Executes the command. This method is abstract and must be implemented by any concrete subclass of Command.
* @param tasks   The TaskList object containing the current list of tasks.
* @param ui      The Ui object responsible for interacting with the user.
* @param storage The Storage object responsible for saving and loading tasks.
* @throws CharlotteException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CharlotteException;
* Returns whether this command is an exit command.
* @return true if this command is an exit command; false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand instance with the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted from the task list.
* Executes the command to delete the task from the task list, updates the user interface, and saves the updated task list.
* This method checks if the index is valid, removes the task at the given index from the TaskList,
* informs the user of the successful removal, and then saves the updated task list to storage.
* @param tasks The TaskList object from which the task will be deleted.
* @param ui The Ui object used to communicate with the user.
* @param storage The Storage object used to save the updated task list.
* @throws CharlotteException If the index is out of bounds or if an error occurs while saving the task list to storage.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CharlotteException {
throw new CharlotteException("Task number is invalid. Please try again");
ui.showMessage("Noted. I've removed this task:\n " + deletedTask
+ "\n Now you have " + tasks.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents a command to terminate the application.
* Executes the command to terminate the application.
* @param tasks The TaskList object, which is not used in this command.
* @param ui The Ui object used to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The Storage object, which is not used in this command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to find tasks by a given keyword.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for in tasks.
* Executes the find command by searching for tasks that contain the keyword.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to search through.
* @param ui The user interface to display the results.
* @param storage The storage to save the tasks (not used in this command).
* @throws CharlotteException If an error occurs during the execution.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CharlotteException {
ui.showMessage("No tasks found matching the keyword: " + keyword);
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command to display the list of tasks.
* Executes the command to display the list of tasks.
* This method checks if the task list is empty. If it is, it displays a message informing the user
* that the list is empty. If not, it prints a numbered list of all tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks The TaskList object containing all the tasks to be displayed.
* @param ui The Ui object used to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The Storage object, which is not used in this command.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.showMessage("Your task list is currently empty");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* Constructs a MarkCommand with the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task in the task list to be marked as done.
* Executes the command to mark a task as done.
* This method checks if the provided index is valid (i.e., within the range of the task list). If it is
* valid, the task at the specified index is marked as done, and the updated task list is saved to storage.
* The user is informed of the successful update via the UI. If the index is invalid, a CharlotteException
* @param tasks The TaskList object containing all the tasks, including the one to be marked as done.
* @param ui The Ui object used to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The Storage object used to save the updated task list.
* @throws CharlotteException If the provided index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CharlotteException {
throw new CharlotteException("Task number is invalid. Please try again");
ui.showMessage("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n " + task);
* Represents a command to unmark a task as not done.

* @param index The index of the task in the task list to be unmarked.

* to storage. The user is informed of the successful update via the UI. If the index is invalid, a

* @param ui The Ui object used to display messages to the user.
* @param storage The Storage object used to save the updated task list.
* @throws CharlotteException If the provided index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws CharlotteException {
throw new CharlotteException("Task number is invalid. Please try again");
ui.showMessage("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n  " + task);
* The CharlotteException class represents exceptions specific to the Charlotte chatbot.
* It extends the Exception class to provide custom error handling for issues that may arise within the app.
* The Parser class is responsible for interpreting user input
* and returning the appropriate command to be executed.
* Parses the user input and returns the corresponding Command object.
* @param userInput The input string entered by the user.
* @return The Command object corresponding to the user's input.
* @throws CharlotteException If the user input is not recognized or formatted incorrectly.

* Represents a task that has a deadline.
* This task contains a description and a due date.
* Constructs a Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date of the task in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* Returns the due date of the task.
* @return The due date of the task as a LocalDate.
* Converts the deadline task to a suitable format for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the deadline task in a file format.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task.
* The string includes the task type, status icon, description, and due date.
* @return A string representation of the deadline task.
* Represents a task that spans a period of time, with a start and end date.
* This task contains a description, a start date, and an end date.
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, start date, and end date.
* @param description The description of the event task.
* @param from The start date of the event in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* @param to The end date of the event in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the start date of the event.

* Converts the event task to a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the event task in a file format.
* Returns a string representation of the event task.
* The string includes the task type, status icon, description, start date, and end date.
* @return A string representation of the event task.
* Represents a task with a description and completion status.
* This is an abstract class that other specific types of tasks (e.g., ToDo, Deadline, Event)
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* If the task is done, an "X" is returned; otherwise, a space is returned.

* Unmarks the task as done, setting its status back to not done.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Converts the task to a suitable format for saving to a file.
* This method should be implemented by subclasses to ensure that
* task-specific details are included in the file format.
* @return A string representing the task in a file format.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* The string includes the task's status icon and its description.
* @return A string representation of the task.
* Represents a list of tasks. It provides methods to access
* and alter tasks in the list, such as adding, deleting, and retrieving tasks.
* Constructs a TaskList with the specified list of tasks.
* @param tasks An ArrayList of tasks to initialize the TaskList.
* Adds a task to the TaskList.
* @param task The task to be added to the list.
* Deletes a task from the TaskList at the specified index.
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.

* @return An ArrayList of tasks in the TaskList.
* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.
* Checks if the TaskList is empty.
* @return true if the TaskList is empty, false otherwise.
* Represents a task that only contains a description.
* This task does not have any specific time or date associated with it.
* Constructs a ToDo task with the specified description.

* Converts the ToDo task to a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the ToDo task in a file format.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task.
* The string includes the task type, status icon, and description.
* @return A string representation of the ToDo task.
* Handles the user interface interactions for the Charlotte chatbot.
* The Ui class is responsible for reading user input and displaying messages and prompts to the user.
* It provides methods to print messages, handle command input, and display error or other messages.
* Constructs a Ui instance with a new Scanner for reading user input.
* Reads the next line of user input from the console.
* @return The line of input entered by the user.
* Prints a horizontal line to the console for formatting purposes.
* This line is used to separate different sections of the UI output.
* Prints a welcome message to the console when the application starts.
* This method displays a greeting and prompts the user to enter commands.
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Charlotte!\nWhat can I do for you?");
* Prints an exit message to the console when the application is about to close.
* This method displays a goodbye message to the user.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

"Exception message should be 'I'm sorry, I don't know what that means :( Please try again!'");
assertEquals(1, tasks.getSize(), "Task list size should be 1 after adding a task");
assertEquals(task, tasks.getTask(0), "The task added should be the same as the one retrieved");
